thread.title: Hit with lack of institutional control, Ole Miss imposes postseason ban for 2017
thread.title_full: Hit with lack of institutional control, Ole Miss imposes postseason ban for 2017

author: Tom Fornelli
title: Hit with lack of institutional control, Ole Miss imposes postseason ban for 2017
text:
Hit with lack of institutional control, Ole Miss imposes postseason ban for 2017 The Rebels have been hit with 21 allegations in football of which they agree with just three • 1 min read Hugh Freeze may face sanctions based on these allegations. USATSI 
Ole Miss on Wednesday announced that it will self-impose a one-year postseason ban for the 2017 campaign amid receiving an official notice of allegations from the NCAA, which concluded its investigation into violations made by the football program. 
The NCAA has come to the conclusion that the “scope and nature of the violations demonstrate that the university lacked institutional control and failed to monitor the conduct and administration of its athletics program.” Ole Miss has decided to contest this serious Level I violation. 
CBS Sports will update this breaking news story shortly.
